intro: Lindsaea phassa, commonly known as the slender lindsaea, is a species of fern belonging to the family Bromeliaceae. It is native to the tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil. This plant is characterized by its delicate, elongated leaves that form a rosette structure. Lindsaea phassa typically grows in shaded, moist environments such as forests and rocky areas. Its unique morphology and ecological adaptations make it an interesting subject for botanical study.
